data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always begin your journey from forward with the right foot planted firmly on the forward step. The first 9 steps are the first step up.  You take 9 steps left, then 10 steps forward, then 9 steps right, then 10 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn left whenever you turn about. It is considered safest to turn around and turn away. So, the answer is yes.

Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turn right when you get to 7 steps. Then turn left when you get to 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

An example would be if you had to turn left and then right. When you turn around, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

On a straight line, take one step left, then take 2 steps forward. There are 24 degrees between the horizontal lines. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is in the first step and ending in a 7 step sequence (from the point of arrival to return to the start point). So, the answer is Yes.

If facing forward always, a person might fall backward. If one steps backward it is not an accurate direction. So, the answer is no.

If the person is standing always facing forward, and has one step backward, they cannot go back to the starting point. The person may take 5 steps left or take 2 steps left. Thus, the answer is No.

You can take 9 steps left and 10 steps left. These are the same as taking three steps left and one step left. These are the same as taking 3 steps left and one step left, therefore the same as taking 3 steps up and one step backward. These are the same as taking 6 steps left and 3 steps forward. The steps taken backward are taken right after the previous ones taken. So, the answer is No.

When you are taken two steps forward from the starting point, the second step you need to take is to take 2 steps back. In this way, you will have to face the starting point in the direction you are going. So, the answer is No.
